for i in range(1,n+1):

print("""else:

data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the number of conditional statements.
data.outputDescription: The structure of the code separated into multiple lines

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your boss is someone not very reasonable and asks you to write code that is not very efficient. But since you are very intelligent, you could find a way in which your work is not a total hell.

you must generate this code structure for the values ​​from 1 to n (note the 4-space indentation).

if n == 1:
    print("n is 1")
elif n == 2:
    print("n is 2")
elif n == 3:
    print("n is 3")
else:
    print("number not found :(")


You must find a way to generate this code structure efficiently!
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of conditional statements.
Output
The structure of the code separated into multiple lines
Constraints
1 ≤ n ≤ 1000
Example
Input
3
Output
if n == 1:
    print("n is 1")
elif n == 2:
    print("n is 2")
elif n == 3:
    print("n is 3")
else:
    print("number not found :(")
